paper_abstract: In this paper, we use template-semantics to express the execution semantics of UML 2.0 StateMachines, resulting in a precise description that not only highlights the semantics decisions that have been documented but also explicates the semantics choices that have been left unspecified. We provide also the template semantics for StateMachines as implemented in three UML CASE tools: Rational Rose RT, Rhapsody, and Bridgepoint. The result succinctly explicates (1) how each of the tools refines the standard's semantics and (2) which tools' semantics deviate from the standard.
